{{Wireless embedded system |brand=OUYA |model=Game Console |revision=(OUYA1) |upc=856794004003 |asin=B00GHINM5O |price=99 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Pegatron |manuf_model= |availability= |est_release_date=06/04/2013 |fcc_date=04/19/2013 |fcc_id=VUI-OUYA1 |ic_id=7582A-OUYA1 |type=game console |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=nVIDIA |cpu1_model=Tegra 3;(T33-P-A3); |cpu1_cspeed=1.7 GHz |cpu1_cores=4 |fla1=1 GiB |fla1_brand=Kingston |fla1_model=KE4CN3K6A |ram1=1 GiB |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4B4G1646B-HYK0 |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=AzureWave AW-NH660 |wi1_module_if=SDIO (module) |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4330 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags=HDMI 1.4 out |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} :[http://www.ouya.tv/ ''OUYA'' site]
===Specifications=== *CPU: [[nVIDIA]] Quad-core @1.7GHz (ARM Cortex-A9) *GPU: [[nVIDIA]] GeForce ULP @520MHz (12.48 GFLOPS) *RAM: 1GiB DDR3-1600 SDRAM (shared for CPU and GPU) *Flash: 8GB eMMC flash memory (expandable via USB) *HDMI: 1.4 1080p or 720p (Stereoscopic 3D support)
:;Specifications, per the FCC manual, follow.. *CPU: ''[[nVIDIA]]'' Tegra 3 Quad-Core (ARMv7-A) MPCore *Memory: 1GB RAM DDR3-1600 (shared for CPU and GPU) *Storage: 8GB internal Flash storage (exp. via USB port) *USB: One USB 2.0 port, One Micro USB port *Connectivity: Wi-Fi (802.11b/g/n), FE port, Bluetooth *Output: HDMI (up to 1080p) *Case: Sand-blasted Aluminum and Plastic *Dimensions: [[Dimensions::75 mm x 75 mm x 82 mm]] *Weight: [[Weight::300g]]
===Links=== *[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ouya ''Ouya'' on '''Wikipedia'''] :Shipping OS will be Android 4.1 (''Jelly Bean''). *[http://www.ifixit.com/Teardown/Ouya+Teardown/14224/1 Teardown on '''iFixit'''] :"PCB_MADE_IN_CHINA", "OUYA", and "REV: 1.01" is silkscreened on the bottom of the board. :The OUYA1 is using an ''[[SMSC]]'' LAN9500A USB 2.0 Ethernet controller. *[http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ouya/ouya-a-new-kind-of-video-game-console?ref=search ''OUYA: A New Kind of Video Game Console'' - '''OUYA''''s Kickstarter] :- where they raised approx. ~$8,500,000, ended 2012-10-9
